article.text:
The Pentagon Federal Credit Union Foundation will host its Night of Heroes Gala at the Ritz-Carlton in Washington, D.C., on June 3. The black-tie and military-dress event raises money for wounded military members, veterans and their families. This year the gala will honor the Intelligence and Special Operation communities. Former U.S. Secretary of State Condoleezza Rice will give the keynote address. Wounded patients from Walter Reed Army Medical Center and Bethesda National Naval Medical Center and residents from the Armed Forces Retirement Home will be in attendance.
Night of Heroes will begin at 6 p.m. with a reception and silent auction, followed by dinner and program, and will conclude by 9:30 p.m. Companies and individuals interested in sponsorships and tickets should contact Pauline Poh at 703-838-1085 or pauline.poh@penfed.org. More information, including the names of award recipients, is available on the gala website.
